dict.string: The label delimiter separates roll strings from (optional) text labels. All text after the first occurrence of the delimiter (if any) is treated as a label, and not considered to be part of the roll string. The delimiter should not contain whitespace characters, or any characters that may occur in a roll string, or else parsing problems may occur.
The initiative format setting controls whether the output of the INIT command (i.e. the individual initiative rolls) is listed on multiple lines, or all on one line.
